item.title: Polygon Light
item.description:
Polygon Light#

Polygon light is useful to simulate monochromatic area light, such as window of indoor scene, outdoor emissive shapes.

The shape of polygon light is described by a list of polygon vertices, you can change the shape use preset polygons.

Or assign an customized shape to it.

Polygon shape should be centered at transform position.

item.title: Samples
item.description:
Samples#

There are two samples in package, you can import them from PackageManager’s Samples tab and play around.

It seems that the Samples tab is only visible if the package is imported from disk. If it is downloaded from asset store directly, there will not be Samples tab.

If no Samples tab appears, you can also copy Realtime Area Lights/Samples~ folder to Assets.

item.title: Integration
item.description:
Integration#

The integration process is extreamely easy for both shader graph and shader code, no matter you are using an customized SRP render pipeline, or the offical Universal Render Pipeline.

This package works in isolation with render pipeline in most of the time, it extract surface parameters like roughtness, normal, metallic and so on from the render pipeline, do lighting calculation, then add the result back to the original render result.

item.title: Linear Light
item.description:
Linear Light#

Linear light is to simulate light with line shapes, such as laser beam, light sword, light stripes.

It’s shape is slightly different from polygon light, linear light’s shape is determined by only two points: start and end point, its lighting range is a capsule shape.

Attributes#

Range

The radius of a capsule shape, it determines the radius of caps and tube, places outside the capsule will not be lighted.

item.title: Textured Light
item.description:
Textured Light#

Textured light is an rectangular polygon light itself except that it’s not monochromatic.

The radiance at each point is determined by texel in an texture. This extends polygon light a lot, since most area light source in real life is colorful, like billboard, screen.

In order to mimic roughness appearance, we will prefilter the texture with different gaussian blur kernel size and store them in texture mipmaps. The prefilter process can be executed once at start up for static textures, or per-frame for realtime changed render textures.
